p: Remdesivir, (adenosine analogue) as a potent phosphoramidate prodrug, is effective against filoviruses, pneumoviruses and paramyxoviruses with two suggested mechanisms of action (Lo et al., 2017). One is being as nucleoside analogue and the second is acting on viral RdRp. Accordingly, Peters et al evaluated the efficiency of some nucleoside analogues suggesting that compound 2 with EC50 < 10 μM was promising against HCoV‐NL63 (Peters et al., 2015). The combinations of nucleotide analogues can mitigate the resistance mediated by mutations in the viral RdRp, perhaps by additive or synergistic interactions effect (Pruijssers & Denison, 2019). Despite the proofreading activity, identifying nucleoside analogue inhibitors hold promise for the treatment of SARS‐CoV‐2.
